result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L. Schaff

records.addlTxt:
**CORRECTION TO ENTRY ON 10-14-2022**

Plea and sentencing scheduled on December 20, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Steven L. Schaff in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Steven L. Schaff.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested date for Plea/Sentencing. Court addressed good JusticePoint Report and encouraged the defendant to continue the good work. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven L. Schaff in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Steven L. Schaff.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting an additional status. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Change of Address letter filed by defense

Defendant Steven L. Schaff in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Amanda Kirklewski for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven L. Schaff in court with Attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061222,
Payable Number: 1017420,
Receipt Number: 22RP026905,
Amount: $20.00
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLS

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Steven L. Schaff in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Steven L. Schaff in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven L. Schaff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
